intro: Cologania lemmonii, commonly known as the Lemmon's cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, mat-forming cactus with ribbed stems that are typically green or blue-green in color. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a striking visual contrast to its foliage. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought and extreme temperatures. Cologania lemmonii is often found in rocky soils and is a characteristic plant of desert ecosystems.
